Class MonitoredStatus

java.lang.Object
  create_sample.MonitoredStatus
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class MonitoredStatus
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Represents a tweet we're monitoring or have monitored.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Jos√© Parada

Constructor Detail

MonitoredStatus

public MonitoredStatus(long id,
                       java.lang.String text,
                       java.util.Date tweetCreated,
                       boolean isDirect,
                       boolean isMention,
                       boolean isHashtag,
                       boolean isURL,
                       boolean isExclamation,
                       boolean isQuestion,
                       boolean hasPositiveEmoticon,
                       boolean hasNegativeEmoticon,
                       int followerNumber,
                       java.lang.String sentiment,
                       java.lang.String topic)
Constructor. Initializes a new tweet to be monitored with its observed values.

Parameters:
id - this tweet's ID in the Twitter network.
text - The text of this tweet. 140 characters or less!
tweetCreated - The date and time this tweet was posted.
isDirect - Whether this tweet is a direct mention or not. Direct mentions are tweets that start with a mention (an username reference).
isMention - Whether this tweet has a mention or not.
isHashtag - Whether this tweet has a hashtag or not.
isURL - Whether this tweet has an URL or not.
isExclamation - Whether this tweet has an exclamation mark or not.
isQuestion - Whether this tweet has a question mark or not.
hasPositiveEmoticon - Whether this tweet has a positive emoticon or not. We consider ":-)", ":)", ";)", ";-)", ":D", ":-D" as positive emoticons.
hasNegativeEmoticon - Whether this tweet has a negative emoticon or not. We consider ":(", ":-(", "D:", "D-:", ";_;" as negative emoticons.
followerNumber - The number of followers the author has.
sentiment - The sentiment of this tweet. Positive, negative or neutral.
topic - The topic of this tweet, classified from a pool of 18 news topics.
See Also:
SentimentClassifier, TopicClassifier
Method Detail

getTopic

public java.lang.String getTopic()
Returns this tweet's topic, from a pool of 18 news topics. The possible topics are:
  • Business_Finance
  • Disaster_Accident
  • Education
  • Entertainment_Culture
  • Environment
  • Health_Medical_Pharma
  • Hospitality_Recreation
  • Human Interest
  • Labor
  • Law_Crime
  • Other
  • Politics
  • Religion_Belief
  • Social Issues
  • Sports
  • Technology_Internet
  • War_Conflict
  • Weather

Returns:
This tweet's topic.
See Also:
TopicClassifier

setTopic

public void setTopic(java.lang.String topic)
Sets this tweet's topic.

Parameters:
topic - This tweet's topic.
See Also:
TopicClassifier

getSentiment

public java.lang.String getSentiment()
Returns this tweet's sentiment. Positive, negative or neutral, expressed "pos", "neg" or "neu".

Returns:
This tweet's sentiment: "pos", "neg" or "neu".

setSentiment

public void setSentiment(java.lang.String sentiment)
Sets this tweet's sentiment.

Parameters:
sentiment - The tweet's sentiment.

getCombined

public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Double> getCombined()
Returns a list containing this tweet's combined statistic, measured every 15 minutes. We define the combined statistic as the number of retweets multiplied by the retweet likelihood.

Returns:
This tweet's number of retweets multiplied by the retweet likelihood.

setCombined

public void setCombined(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Double> combined)
Sets the list of this tweet's combined statistic, measured every 15 minutes. We define the combined statistic as the number of retweets multiplied by the retweet likelihood.

Parameters:
combined - A list containing this tweet's combined statistic every 15 minutes.

getTreeDepth

public int getTreeDepth()
Returns the depth of this tweet's diffusion tree. A tweet's diffusion tree is a tree where each node is a retweeting user and each edge points in the direction of the tweet flow. That means that if user A retweeted the tweet, and user B follows user A and retweeted the tweet after him, user B will be a child of user A in the tree.

Returns:
The depth of this tweet's diffusion tree.

setTreeDepth

public void setTreeDepth(int treeDepth)
Set the depth of this tweet's diffusion tree. A tweet's diffusion tree is a tree where each node is a retweeting user and each edge points in the direction of the tweet flow. That means that if user A retweeted the tweet, and user B follows user A and retweeted the tweet after him, user B will be a child of user A in the tree.

Parameters:
treeDepth - The depth of this tweet's diffusion tree.

hasMention

public boolean hasMention()
Returns whether this tweet has a mention or not. A mention is a reference to an username, written as @username.

Whether this tweet has a mention or not.

setMention

Sets whether this tweet has a mention or not. A mention is a reference to an username, written as @username.

Parameters:
hasMention - Whether this tweet has a mention or not.

hasHashtag

public boolean hasHashtag()
Returns whether this tweet has a hashtag or not. A hashtag is a way to classify a tweet within the Twitter network. By writing a # symbol followed by a string, the tweet, and the rest of the tweets with the same hashtag, can be found using Twitter's search tool. This is a good way to discuss a certain topic in a thread-like structure.

Returns:
Whether this tweet has a hashtag or not.

setHashtag

public void setHashtag(boolean hasHashtag)
Sets whether this tweet has a hashtag or not. A hashtag is a way to classify a tweet within the Twitter network. By writing a # symbol followed by a string, the tweet, and the rest of the tweets with the same hashtag, can be found using Twitter's search tool. This is a good way to discuss a certain topic in a thread-like structure.

Parameters:
hasHashtag - Whether this tweet has a hashtag or not.

addObservation

public void addObservation(int oRetweetCount,
                           double oRetweetLikelihood)
Adds an observation of the number of retweets, the retweet likelihood and the combined statistic of this tweet. This method is called every 15 minutes to keep an accurate record of these measurements. If the retweet amount is the same as the previously observed amount, the count of inactive periods goes up. A tweet is considered dead when it reaches 4 inactive periods, which is an hour of inactivity.

Parameters:
oRetweetCount - The number of retweets observed in this period.
oRetweetLikelihood - The retweet likelihood observed in this period.

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns whether this tweet is the same as the tweet passed in the argument. We consider two tweets to be the same if they share the same ID.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
Parameters:
obj - The tweet to compare this tweet against.
Returns:
True if the tweets have the same ID, false otherwise.

getInactivePeriods

public int getInactivePeriods()
Returns the amount of periods since this tweet's last retweet. Periods are 15 minutes long, and a tweet is considered dead when it reaches an hour of inactivity.

Returns:
The amount of periods since this tweet's last retweet.
